title: Fisherman missing after boat capsizes in seas off Eravur
byline: A fisherman has been reported missing after a boat which ventured into the sea from the Kaluwankerny, Eravur coastal area yesterday (28), had capsized, police stated.

title: Fair weather to prevail across the country; Misty conditions expected in some places
byline: Mainly dry weather will prevail in most parts of the island.

title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
byline: A passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, the country’s state-run airline Satena confirmed.

title: Chinese cultural event series kick off in Sri Lanka
byline: The opening gala of the 2026 “Happy Chinese New Year” cultural events in Sri Lanka was held at the Nelum Pokuna Theatre, marking the beginning of a series of celebrations ahead of the traditional Chinese holiday.

title: Sri Lanka considering restricting access to social media for children under 12
byline: The government is considering restricting access to social media for children under the age of 12, Minister of Women and Child Affairs Savithri Paulraj said.

title: Gold price jumps above US$ 5,500 for the first time on record
byline: Gold price surges to a fresh record high of US$ 5,579 before retreating to around US$ 5,500 in early Asian trading on Thursday.

title: New education reforms for Grade One begin today
byline: The admission of schoolchildren to Grade One for the academic year 2026 is scheduled to take place today (29).

title: Nine child marriages and 79 teenage pregnancies reported in 2025: NCPA
byline: A total of 10,455 complaints related to children have been lodged with the National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) in 2025.

title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia
byline: China has executed 11 members of a notorious family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

title: Singapore to conduct temperature screening at airport over Nipah outbreak
byline: Singapore will step up health screening at Changi Airport after a Nipah virus outbreak in West Bengal, India, including temperature checks for flights from affected areas, authorities have said.

title: Woman hacked to death in Bibile
byline: A 40-year-old woman has been murdered with a sharp weapon in Radaliyadda, Bibile, yesterday (28), police stated.

title: ASP Rohan Olugala appointed as Director of Walana Central Anti-Corruption Unit
byline: Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Rohan Olugala has been appointed as the Director of the Walana Central Anti-Corruption Unit, the Police Headquarters stated.

title: PM Harini launches education reforms for Grade One students
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has officially launched national education reforms for Grade 1 students during a ceremony held at the Gunasekara Vidyalaya in Athurugiriya.

title: Public advised not to panic amid Nipah virus concerns in India
byline: The general public has been advised not to panic regarding the Nipah virus outbreak currently spreading in India.

title: Six police officers arrested over alleged assault on Catholic Priest granted bail
byline: Six police officers attached to the Gampaha Divisional Crime Detection Bureau (DCDB), who were arrested in connection with the alleged assault on a Catholic priest, have been granted bail.

title: Agricultural Insurance Month declared for farmers
byline: The Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation has announced an Agricultural Insurance Month for farmers, effective from February 2026.

title: Bribery case filed against Rajitha Senaratne adjourned till Apr. 29
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Bribery Commission against former Minister of Fisheries Rajitha Senaratne and two others for allegedly causing a loss to the government when the Mutwal Fishery Harbour was leased to a private company in 2014—be reconvened on April 29.

title: Special traffic plan announced for Annual Gangaramaya Navam Maha Perahera
byline: A special traffic plan has been announced in Colombo in view of the Annual Gangaramaya Navam Maha Perahera.

title: Sri Lanka, Pakistan launch digital partnership
byline: Sri Lanka and Pakistan have agreed to deepen partnership in the digital economy by establishing a Joint Working Group on Information Technology and Digital Economy, marking a new phase in bilateral collaboration focused on emerging technologies and digital transformation.

title: IMF team expected in a matter of weeks to resume talks on Sri Lanka’s fifth EFF review
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has announced plans to dispatch a mission to Sri Lanka at the earliest opportunity to resume discussions on economic policies as part of the fifth review of the Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

title: Case against Namal Rajapaksa to be taken up in July
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has scheduled the next hearing of the complaint against Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act for July 30, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Three police officers identified in alleged assault on Catholic Priest in Gampaha
byline: Three of the six police officers attached to the Gampaha Divisional Crime Detection Bureau (DCDB), who were arrested in connection with the alleged assault on a Catholic priest, have been identified.

title: Police apprehend five suspects in series of vehicle thefts
byline: A total of five individuals have been apprehended in connection with multiple vehicle thefts, including cars, three-wheelers and motorcycles, police stated.

title: Veteran film director Sena Samarasinghe passes away
byline: Veteran film director Sena Samarasinghe has passed away at the age of 89.

title: Gold prices increase by Rs. 15,000 in Sri Lanka
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has risen following a surge in global gold prices.

title: Public Finance Committee briefed on challenges facing gem and jewellery sector
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (COPF) of Parliament has held extensive discussions on key issues affecting Sri Lanka’s gem and jewellery industry.

title: Kalutara MC member granted bail over assault on motorcyclist during SJB protest
byline: The Kalutara Magistrate’s Court today (29) ordered the release on bail of Kalutara Municipal Council member Jayanath Navaratne, who was arrested in connection with an assault incident that occurred yesterday during a protest staged by a group of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) activists in Kalutara town.

title: Starmer, Xi signal reset in China-UK ties, eye economic wins
byline: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer told Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday that he wanted to build a “sophisticated relationship” with Beijing to boost the UK economy, signalling a reset after years of strained ties.

title: India should consider age-based limits for social media access, economic adviser says
byline: India’s annual economic survey presented on Thursday recommended age-based limits to be considered for access to social media and gambling apps to counter what it called “digital addiction” in the country.

title: Hunger strike launched by Development Officers at Presidential Secretariat enters fourth day
byline: The hunger strike launched by a group of Development Officers opposite the Presidential Secretariat— demanding that they be absorbed into the teacher service —continues today (29) for its fourth day.

title: UK Government offers free AI skills to every adult
byline: The UK Government has announced a plan to give every adult in the UK the opportunity to take free, newly benchmarked courses to gain practical Artificial Intelligence skills for work.

title: Mattel reveals iconic Ken doll’s full name ahead of its 65th birthday
byline: Ken doll has been in the market for 65 years now. It first hit the shelves in 1961. Ahead of its 65th birthday in March this year, Mattel, one of the global toy and family entertainment companies, announced Ken’s full name. Well, it is Kenneth Sean Carson.

title: Official allegedly misappropriates ‘Aswesuma’ allowance; investigations launched
byline: Investigations have been launched into an alleged fraud involving the payment of the ‘Aswesuma’ allowance in the Kataragama Divisional Secretariat.

title: Agreements to increase estate workers’ daily wage to be signed tomorrow
byline: The Ministry of Plantations and Community Infrastructure has announced that the signing of agreements to increase the daily wages of estate workers will be held tomorrow (30) with the regional plantation companies.

title: Woman arrested with cocaine and ecstasy pills worth Rs. 220 million
byline: A 48-year-old woman has been arrested in Ganemulla with 4.5 kilograms of cocaine and more than 3,400 ecstasy pills, with an estimated street value of around Rs. 220 million.

title: Special traffic plan for 78th Independence Day celebration and rehearsals
byline: Sri Lanka Police said a special traffic plan will be implemented in view of the 78th National Independence Day celebrations, which are scheduled to take place under the theme ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’, and the preceding rehearsals for the event.

title: Sri Lanka’s Health Ministry assures early preparedness amid Nipah virus concerns
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media has issued an official statement addressing public concerns following recent media reports on the Nipah virus.

title: Nicki Minaj snags Trump gold card after saying she is his ‘No. 1 fan’
byline: Nicki Minaj revealed that she received a so-called Trump “gold card” that offers applicants residency and a path to U.S. citizenship, following an appearance at an event touting President Donald Trump’s government-supported investment accounts for babies.

title: IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva to visit Sri Lanka next month
byline: The Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Kristalina Georgieva is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka next month, according to a top IMF official.

title: China relaxes visa rules for UK citizens on PM’s trip to Beijing
byline: China agreed to relax rules to allow some visa-free travel for British citizens on Thursday during a visit by Prime Minister Keir Starmer to Beijing, as part of a partnership deal which London hopes will help expand its service sector.

title: Public officials must clearly understand public expectations against corruption and fraud - Secretary to the President
byline: A workshop to brief the heads of 250 state institutions that have been instructed to establish Internal Affairs Units was held today (29) at the auditorium of the Sri Lanka Foundation Institute, under the patronage of Secretary to the President, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake.

title: NMCRP warns of potential local coconut oil price hike risk
byline: The National Movement for Consumer Rights Protection (NMCRP) has warned that due to the budget proposal submitted by the government to remove the Special Commodity Levy on coconut oil and palm oil, it could lead to serious market and health-related consequences.

title: Former Sathosa Senior Manager and two others arrested by CIABOC
byline: A former Senior Manager (Supplies) of Lanka Sathosa and two other individuals have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).
